questions:
What is the main focus of the photo?
A) A scenic landscape
B) Graffiti with a message
C) A group of people
D) An architectural structure

Where was the photo likely taken?
A) In a park
B) On a building wall
C) On a sidewalk or pavement
D) Inside a museum

What message is conveyed in the photo?
A) "Love and Peace"
B) "Pride Was a Riot"
C) "Save the Earth"
D) "No War"

What is the texture of the surface where the message is written?
A) Smooth and polished
B) Rough and uneven
C) Shiny and reflective
D) Soft and sandy

What is the color of the text in the photo?
A) Red
B) Blue
C) Black
D) Green

How is the message written?
A) In cursive handwriting
B) In block letters
C) In a mix of styles
D) In calligraphy

What is the likely medium used to write the message?
A) Chalk
B) Spray paint
C) Marker
D) Pen

What is the background of the photo?
A) A colorful mural
B) A plain, rough surface
C) A busy street
D) A forest

What is the position of the word "Pride" in the message?
A) At the bottom
B) In the middle
C) At the top
D) On the side

What punctuation is used at the end of the message?
A) A period
B) An exclamation mark
C) A question mark
D) No punctuation

What does the underline in the message emphasize?
A) The entire message
B) The word "Pride"
C) The word "Riot"
D) The word "Was"

What is the overall color scheme of the photo?
A) Bright and colorful
B) Monochrome
C) Dark and muted
D) Pastel

What is the relationship between the text and the surface it is written on?
A) The text blends in with the surface
B) The text contrasts sharply with the surface
C) The text is barely visible on the surface
D) The text matches the surface

What is the central element of the photo?
A) The background
B) The message
C) Decorative elements
D) People

What is the condition of the surface where the message is written?
A) New and clean
B) Worn and aged
C) Wet and muddy
D) Cracked and broken

What is the message's alignment on the surface?
A) Centered
B) Aligned to the left
C) Aligned to the right
D) Scattered randomly

What kind of surface is the message written on?
A) Wood
B) Metal
C) Concrete or asphalt
D) Glass

What is the mood created by the photo?
A) Calm and serene
B) Tense and urgent
C) Happy and festive
D) Reflective and thoughtful

What is the perspective of the photo?
A) Aerial view
B) Ground-level view
C) Side view
D) Close-up view

What kind of event does the message likely refer to?
A) A music festival
B) A sports event
C) A political protest or demonstration
D) A cultural exhibition

What is the overall composition of the photo?
A) Symmetrical
B) Asymmetrical
C) Radial
D) Grid-like

What is the size of the text in the photo?
A) Very small
B) Medium-sized
C) Large and bold
D) Tiny and delicate

What is the foreground of the photo?
A) Decorative elements
B) The message text
C) People interacting
D) Natural scenery

What is the spacing of the text in the photo?
A) Very close together
B) Evenly spaced
C) Widely spaced
D) Overlapping

What is the likely method used to create the message?
A) Hand-drawn
B) Stenciled
C) Digitally printed
D) Spray-painted

What is the primary visual element of the photo?
A) Color contrast
B) Text message
C) Background scenery
D) People

What is the overall aesthetic of the photo?
A) Minimalist
B) Ornate
C) Grungy
D) Clean and modern

What is the likely message behind the phrase "Pride Was a Riot"?
A) Pride events are chaotic
B) Pride has historical roots in activism

D) Pride is a peaceful event

How is the message positioned in the photo?
A) Diagonally
B) Horizontally
C) Vertically
D) In a circular pattern

What is the photo about?
A) Nature and landscapes
B) Daily life and people

A) A peaceful nature scene
